Change-Id: Ic34ea5ead26a477a1cc5f8b25fd2ce1949c1dc13
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579434
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-07-19 03:26:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add trigger-readthedocs-webhook job

This job is to trigger readthedocs via their new API

The old API was quite simple in that anyone could hit the end-point
and trigger a new build.  We now require authentication and a unique
webhook id for each project we wish to update.

This leaves us with a bit of an issue with the "docs-on-readthedocs"
job template, which adds the "trigger-readthedocs" job to the
post/publish pipelines for a project.

If projects wish, they can directly use the new "trigger-readthedocs"
role (from the dependent change) and provide their username/password
or webhook token directly from a secret in their project playbook.

However, this proposes retaining delegation of the build via infra
methods.  Projects that wish to use it then don't have to worry about
managing new jobs or their secrets, and gain some benefits in having a
backup that the infra team can help manage the project easily
(changing, deleting, renaming etc).

Thus to continue using the "docs-on-readthedocs" template, projects
will need to do three things

1) add openstackci user as an admin of their project
2) generate an webhook via the "Integrations" dashboard page on the
   RTD project
3) provide the id from that webhook URL to this playbook

This webhook id is not private; it is useless without authentication
(it appears to be a global monotonically increasing integer for each
webhook generated).  Thus we can store it in plaintext in the job
playbook.

A secret is added for the openstackci RTD user, which is then used to
ping the API endpoint via the new role in the dependent change.

Change-Id: Ic34ea5ead26a477a1cc5f8b25fd2ce1949c1dc13
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579434

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2018-07-30 01:36:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add trigger-readthedocs-webhook job

This job is to trigger readthedocs via their new API

The old API was quite simple in that anyone could hit the end-point
and trigger a new build.  The v2 API now requires authentication and a
unique id for each project we wish to update.

If projects wish, they can directly use the new "trigger-readthedocs"
role (from the dependent change) and create their own jobs, providing
their username/password or webhook authentication token directly from
a secret in their project playbook.

This job, however, uses the infra secret for the "openstackci" user to
update the docs.  Projects that wish to take this route require some
minor setup, but don't have to worry about managing new jobs or their
secrets and gain some benefits in having the openstackci user as a
backup admin.

To use the trigger-readthedocs-webhook job, projects will need to do
the following:

1) add openstackci user as an admin of their RTD project

2) generate an webhook via the "Integrations" dashboard page on the
   RTD project

3) provide the id from that webhook URL in job or project variables.
   This webhook id is not private; it is useless without
   authentication (it appears to be a global monotonically increasing
   integer for each webhook generated).

4) include the job. gerrit-dash-creator is populated with the new job
   for initial testing.  Other projects are currently using the
   "docs-on-readthedocs" template.  Change
   I3b65813671961d07c0a743685c537ad1df4bf68 proposes switching the
   template to use this new job.

Change-Id: Ic34ea5ead26a477a1cc5f8b25fd2ce1949c1dc13

commit_message:
Add trigger-readthedocs-webhook job

This job is to trigger readthedocs via their new API

The old API was quite simple in that anyone could hit the end-point
and trigger a new build.  The v2 API now requires authentication and a
unique id for each project we wish to update.

If projects wish, they can directly use the new "trigger-readthedocs"
role (from the dependent change) and create their own jobs, providing
their username/password or webhook authentication token directly from
a secret in their project playbook.

This job, however, uses the infra secret for the "openstackci" user to
update the docs.  Projects that wish to take this route require some
minor setup, but don't have to worry about managing new jobs or their
secrets and gain some benefits in having the openstackci user as a
backup admin.

To use the trigger-readthedocs-webhook job, projects will need to do
the following:

1) add openstackci user as an admin of their RTD project

2) generate an webhook via the "Integrations" dashboard page on the
   RTD project

3) provide the id from that webhook URL in job or project variables.
   This webhook id is not private; it is useless without
   authentication (it appears to be a global monotonically increasing
   integer for each webhook generated).

4) include the job. gerrit-dash-creator is populated with the new job
   for initial testing.  Other projects are currently using the
   "docs-on-readthedocs" template.  Change
   I3b65813671961d07c0a743685c537ad1df4bf68 proposes switching the
   template to use this new job.

Change-Id: Ic34ea5ead26a477a1cc5f8b25fd2ce1949c1dc13
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579434
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584230

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary PlacementFixture setups

The _IntegratedTestBase functional test base class sets up the
PlacementFixture unconditionally so the deriver test class doesn't need
to do that. This patch removes the extra setups.

Change-Id: I68b939f09fdecc59ccd258595a9b80e6f42a5df1

commit_message:
Fix manila update, upgrade, and FFU tasks

Manila has a similar service architecture to Cinder and the
latter has received several fixes for update, upgrade, and FFU
tasks that are missing in Manila.

Align these tasks in the Manila services with Cinder versions
of the same.

Closes-Bug: #1784032

Change-Id: Ifae95bae859a301e6bcf67910cd9140f51584bb3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 02:05:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Always set a hardware architecture on uploaded images

In a multiarch environment if we have an image that doesn't have an
hw_architecture it can be scheduled on any node registered with ironic.
So this means that nova could schedule an x86_64 image on a ppc64le node
(clearly a bad thing).

Avoid that by always setting a hw_architecture image property matching
the kernel of the running system.  This is safe as in a single arch
environment, by definition all nodes are the same ;P and in a multiarch
we're being explict, which may result in NoValidHost exceptions which is
a much clearer error case than scheduling wrong ISA images.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I082dfe34cf192f76f87e348aecb67e984e0c8ae9
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-07-11 06:32:14.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_image/test_overcloud_image.py'], 'message': "Always set a hardware architecture on uploaded images

In a multiarch environment if we have an image that doesn't have an
hw_architecture it can be scheduled on any node registered with ironic.
So this means that nova could schedule an x86_64 image on a ppc64le node
(clearly a bad thing).

Avoid that by always setting a hw_architecture image property matching
the kernel of the running system.  This is safe as in a single arch
environment, by definition all nodes are the same ;P and in a multiarch
we're being explict, which may result in NoValidHost exceptions which is
a much clearer error case than scheduling wrong ISA images.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I082dfe34cf192f76f87e348aecb67e984e0c8ae9
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Always set a hardware architecture on uploaded images

In a multiarch environment if we have an image that doesn't have an
hw_architecture it can be scheduled on any node registered with ironic.
So this means that nova could schedule an x86_64 image on a ppc64le node
(clearly a bad thing).

Avoid that by always setting a hw_architecture image property matching
the kernel of the running system.  This is safe as in a single arch
environment, by definition all nodes are the same ;P and in a multiarch
we're being explict, which may result in NoValidHost exceptions which is
a much clearer error case than scheduling wrong ISA images.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I082dfe34cf192f76f87e348aecb67e984e0c8ae9

commit_message:
Update/upgrade prepare/converge in config-download era

We inherit the `prepare` commands from deploy, in Rocky we will
automatically get config-download env file there so no need to
explicitly disable DeploymentSteps in *-prepare.yaml files too. We
should also disable the WorkflowSteps in config-download environment,
as they too aren't meant to be used with config-download.

Similarly, for `converge` commands in the *-converge.yaml files we
shouldn't re-enable the DeploymentSteps and WorkflowSteps, as that
would go against using config-download.

Change-Id: I89f54ba9a0a15afd26da4d4b26aba8ef09ebf04b

commit_message:
Fix publish-openstack-docs-pti check/gate html

The new publish-openstack-docs-pti template uses the openstack-tox-docs
job which does not save the rendered docs, nor does it set the job link
to the rendered documents.
This patch changes the openstack-tox-docs job to save the rendered html
and set the success-url to the rendered html documents.
This returns the behavior the publish-openstack-sphinx-docs job provided.

Change-Id: I460c00542426f6b24a7423098be9a0af14a35f01

commit_message:
WIP - Add HSTS Header to apache config for Horizon

This change adds:

Header add Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=15768000"

to the Horizon apache configuration in order to enforce that
all communications go over SSL.[0]

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0035

Change-Id: I8cbc03443e3e792f50cf4ce51a78190628b1d0cd

commit_message:
Support containerized DVR in compute role

This patch adds the required parameters to the Compute role so the
agents are configured properly on upgrade.

Conflicts:
	environments/neutron-ovs-dvr.yaml

Related-Bug: #1774199
Change-Id: Iab42ae0fb13e8e92cc9903432a95e04a94a5913c
(cherry picked from commit f51f84e7818f7f70e4f6f298fff6d57509af4fbd)

commit_message:
Keycloak and Docker

* Added Keycloak to the infrastructure yaml which uses a
h2 not to complicate the installation.
* Updated the docker-compose docs.
* Move Cloud Flow image to the infrastructure yaml.

Change-Id: I2a69ca91c1638e5fd070c77ca63c8d5586887231
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

subject: Deprecate enable_rbac configuration option
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 15:34:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Deprecate enable_rbac configuration option

The ``[patrole].enable_rbac`` option is deprecated and will be removed
during the "S" release. This is a legacy option that was meaningful
downstream when Patrole was a suite of tests inside Tempest itself. Now
that Patrole exists upstream as a Tempest plugin, it is paradoxical to
install the Patrole plugin yet have an option that allows all Patrole
tests to be skipped. This option is at odds with current Patrole
architecture.

To skip RBAC tests going forward, with Patrole Tempest plugin already
installed, use an appropriate regex.

Change-Id: I0cc39184c7891fb9133a45488a36ba220592915f

commit_message:
Deprecate enable_rbac configuration option

The ``[patrole].enable_rbac`` option is deprecated and will be removed
during the "S" release. This is a legacy option that was meaningful
downstream when Patrole was a suite of tests inside Tempest itself. Now
that Patrole exists upstream as a Tempest plugin, it is paradoxical to
install the Patrole plugin yet have an option that allows all Patrole
tests to be skipped. This option is at odds with current Patrole
architecture.

To skip RBAC tests going forward, with Patrole Tempest plugin already
installed, use an appropriate regex.

Change-Id: I0cc39184c7891fb9133a45488a36ba220592915f

commit_message:
Add fs055 to run refstack tests

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570719/ adds support for running
refstack tests, It will replace fs021 for the same and consumed
as a experimental job to run refstack tests.

Change-Id: I3d470dbb8b54615584f00d8a64a9ba752b36b15d

commit_message:
upgrade: move removal of services at step 3 (leftovers)

Move HAproxy, Ironic, Keystone, Zaqar and Mistral package removals at step 3
of upgrade process, required to have a successful containerized undercloud
upgrade.

Also add missing cleanup tasks for Keepalived.

commit_message:
Reduce IP address collision during port creating

Try to give it a large random chance during generate IP
address.

The DB retry mechanism change moved to neutron-lib:
I5ad139bdfb3ae125658b36d05f85f139a1b47bee

Closes-Bug: #1777968
Change-Id: I2acc9c720b39271bde2a89da4a66958f7aba5b7d
(cherry picked from commit ec5cd0d1b85d56adef836bf1167287993ec35ca6)

commit_message:
remove lib-forward-testing tempate from neutron-lib

We are moving away from the legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job to an
in-project job (see depends on patch). This patch removes the
lib-forward-testing template from the neutron-lib project as well as
updates the grafana dashboard for it in favor of the new in-project job.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586613/
Change-Id: I64ceeed44bc1341a873f2357677c93d2647f2970

commit_message:
Wrap interface function for multihash correctly

The store_add_to_backend_with_multihash() function was not wrapped
correctly so that Glance could consume the secure hash value.  This
patch adds the correct wrapping.

Closes-bug: #1784420

(cherry picked from commit 4d4cf1559cf393a2a10a458f83209cbeb2756e49)

Change-Id: I7a94dfffb61fc212abb58c1e1aec5884474b6aa8

commit_message:
Switch to using project-templates

In order to have more centralized configuration, switch the role
to use the project-template instead.

Also move centos check/gate to voting as it now passes.

Change-Id: I356f122a3af8d9ddbc078265b02874936b34d4fe

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-16 16:34:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'rt: use a single ResourceTracker object instance

This patch removes the ResourceTracker.nodename attribute, switches the
compute manager to only create a single ResourceTracker object instance
which itself now has an in-memory dict of ComputeNode objects that are
managed by the nova-compute daemon.

This isolates the code that manages ComputeNode objects and resources in
just the resource tracker, which will make it possible for the scheduler
report client to manage Ironic nodes and custom resource classes
properly. The scheduler report client contains a cache of
ResourceProvider, Inventory, and Allocation records. We definitely did
not want to have multiple ResourceTracker object instances, each with
their own cache of ResourceProvider objects. Having a single
ResourceTracker and single scheduler report client is both more
efficient and a cleaner interface into the compute manager.

Change-Id: I6827137f35c0cb4f9fc4c6f753d9a035326ed01b
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

This patch removes the ResourceTracker.nodename attribute, switches the
compute manager to only create a single ResourceTracker object instance
which itself now has an in-memory dict of ComputeNode objects that are
managed by the nova-compute daemon.

This isolates the code that manages ComputeNode objects and resources in
just the resource tracker, which will make it possible for the scheduler
report client to manage Ironic nodes and custom resource classes
properly. The scheduler report client contains a cache of
ResourceProvider, Inventory, and Allocation records. We definitely did
not want to have multiple ResourceTracker object instances, each with
their own cache of ResourceProvider objects. Having a single
ResourceTracker and single scheduler report client is both more
efficient and a cleaner interface into the compute manager.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Change-Id: I6827137f35c0cb4f9fc4c6f753d9a035326ed01b

commit_message:
rt: use a single ResourceTracker object instance

This patch removes the ResourceTracker.nodename attribute, switches the
compute manager to only create a single ResourceTracker object instance
which itself now has an in-memory dict of ComputeNode objects that are
managed by the nova-compute daemon.

This isolates the code that manages ComputeNode objects and resources in
just the resource tracker, which will make it possible for the scheduler
report client to manage Ironic nodes and custom resource classes
properly. The scheduler report client contains a cache of
ResourceProvider, Inventory, and Allocation records. We definitely did
not want to have multiple ResourceTracker object instances, each with
their own cache of ResourceProvider objects. Having a single
ResourceTracker and single scheduler report client is both more
efficient and a cleaner interface into the compute manager.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Change-Id: I6827137f35c0cb4f9fc4c6f753d9a035326ed01b
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

commit_message:
Add tempest api job from neutron-lib source

Introduce a non-voting job for tempest API test. This job should
help to verify pre-release neutron-lib change on the neutron
master.

Change-Id: I34b7026ad1829db492f942ec9bd2434d37df24b0

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.17

This patch:
- updates all the roles to the latest available stable SHAs
- copies the release notes from the updated roles into the integrated repo
- updates all the OpenStack Service SHAs

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584802/
Change-Id: I643a4e0ffb993f822e8ff64b1e298cd702bffd34

commit_message:
Delete profiler object when request completes

When a request that is being profiled completes and the response is
received, the middleware expires the profiling cookie. It also needs
to delete the profiling object that holds the base_id UUID so a new
base_id will be created for the next profile. Otherwise the same
base_id is used for subsequent queries and they become merged togther
in the database.

Change-Id: I379cebfa2ed5282c96df0e255a8ba04c65a8523c
Closes-Bug: #1777486
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/578362

[{'created': '2018-07-26 07:35:27.000000000', 'files': ['glance/templates/bin/_storage-init.sh.tpl', 'ceph-provisioners/values.yaml', 'ceph-osd/values.yaml', 'gnocchi/templates/bin/_storage-init.sh.tpl', 'cinder/templates/bin/_storage-init.sh.tpl', 'ceph-client/values.yaml', 'cinder/templates/bin/_backup-storage-init.sh.tpl', 'ceph-mon/values.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix ceph version check error in jewel version.

In a jewel version, egrep -c "12.2|luminous" returns "0",
but execution will be error.
So, add pipe and echo command to make a success.

Change-Id: I94f45855f6510e747884d8b6a629a62c3d96adbd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph version check error in jewel version.

In a jewel version, egrep -c "12.2|luminous" returns "0",
but execution will be error.
So, add pipe and echo command to make a success.

Change-Id: I94f45855f6510e747884d8b6a629a62c3d96adbd

commit_message:
Allow non fully qualified hostnames for undercloud

The validation checks that the hostname (fully qualified or not) is
present in the /etc/hosts file and adds it to /etc/hosts otherwise.

Previously the _check_hostname() function would raise an exception if
it had to write the hostname to /etc/hosts and it was not fully
qualified.

This patch make it accept non fully qualified hostnames to match the
actual check.

Closes-Bug: #1737356
Change-Id: I56f886d45de5933fe8438580ff9144edb02009e8
Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshay@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add progress bar for image uploads

This patch adds new option "--progress" to
"openstack overcloud image upload", which enables
uploading progress bar output in the CLI.

Change-Id: I690b32a6eedd949fadea5290896801bfaaac76ce
Partial-bug: #1735465

commit_message:
Don't update whole system on undercloud upgrade

We should update only instack-undercloud package and that should
 take care of any necessary package update.

Remove workaround for openstack-nova-api

We should no longer need to restart nova api service after upgrading
undercloud.

commit_message:
Sync xWorker count description to match new derived defaults

The description text for the neutron related worker counts is no longer
accurate as the puppet defined default is now based on ::os_workers.

Change-Id: Ibb251c1bb24719ce16f8172b4c8ebca8e920f2c6
Depends-On: Ic90461e7d843edf07d884d6717a2dd3e68664b24
